intro: Fuertesiella grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered fuertesiella, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
